column1: #Text=Polycrystalline samples of (Mg,Y)3(Sb,Bi)2 were synthesized using a melting method.

#Text=The raw materials of Mg (3N, chip), Sb (6N, shot), Bi (6N, shot), and Y (3N, powder) were weighed in stoichiometric composition and loaded into an alumina crucible under argon atmosphere in a glovebox where the oxygen concentration was controlled to less than 2 ppm.

#Text=The crucible was sealed in a stainless-steel container [36], heated to 900 °C for 5 h and then to 1180 °C to ensure the complete melting of the raw materials, which were then cooled to room temperature at a rate of 10 °C/h.
#Text=The obtained molten boule was ground to achieve a uniform composition of the samples.
#Text=The pulverized sample was placed into a graphite die and sintered at 600 °C while applying a pressure of 70 MPa for 1 h under Ar flow using a hot press apparatus.
#Text=The as-obtained pellets demonstrated a relative density value of around 98%.
